result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Jesse Steven Poehlman was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse Steven Poehlman is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jesse Steven Poehlman was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Jesse Steven Poehlman was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Jesse Steven Poehlman was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Jesse Steven Poehlman was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Jesse Steven Poehlman was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments, surcharges, DNA surcharge during the sentence imposed in count four.  To be paid by up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance as condition of Extended supervision.   Any unpaid amount will result in a a civil judgment.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three.  Credit for 124 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with Natasha P. unless authorized by DOC supervising agent.

Register as a sex offender.  Sex offender assessment and treatment.
**Conditions of Extended supervision are as to counts four, five, six and seven.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privleges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts three and four.  Credit for 124 days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count five; and concurrent with counts three and four.  Credit for zero days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to counts five and six; and concurrent with counts three and four. Credit for zero days.

records.addlTxt: Cuonts four, five, six and seven.
Count three.

Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion for New Trial has been filed by defense; the state has not filed a response but provides oral argument.  The court has reviewed the defense motion and heard arguments.
The court will not schedule a hearing on the motion as it finds there is no indication of recantation by the victim.  The court has reviewed the trial exhibits prior to today's sentencing.  Sentencing will proceed on today's date.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Natasha P,; Nancy W.
As to count 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction,  with credit for 124 days time served.   Court orders defendant to pay all costs, assessments, surcharges, DNA surcharge during the sentence imposed in count 4, of 2 years Extended Supervision, by up to 25% of prison funds.  Any unpaid amount will result in civil judgment.
As to count 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 124 days time served, concurrent with count 3.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS. (NOTE:  Court orders costs, assessments, surcharges of count 3 to be paid as a part of order of count 4)
As to count 5:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 124 days time served, concurrent with counts 3 and 4.   CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
As to count 6:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 11 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to count 5 and concurrent with counts 3 and 4.  CONFINEMENT of 6 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
As to count 7:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 11 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to counts 6 and 5 and concurrent with counts 3 and 4.  CONFINEMENT of 6 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-NO CONTACT with Natasha P., unless authorized by Department of Corrections supervising agent.
-Register as a sex offender.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded and ordered to report to Dodge Correctional.
Filed:
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Sentence; Ineligible Voting
Exhibits withdrawn from Inventory Box 652 and forwarded to Br 38.
Brief in Support of Defendant's Motion for New Trial filed by defense.
Motion for New Trial filed by defense
Order Restoring Defendant's Telephone and US Mail Privileges signed and filed.
PSI emailed to ADA Liegel and Atty Earle.

Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The defense has not filed a motion at this time to adjourn sentencing of June 11 to complete additional investigation, or a motion for a new trial.  The state would have no objection to a brief adjournment of sentencing upon the filing of motion.  At this time, the court will not adjourn the scheduled sentencing date of June 11.
The court will modify the previously issued order of May 29,2015 which rescinded all communication privileges of the defendant.  The court will allow mail, telephone and in person visitation to be reinstated but continues the ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT ORDER AS TO NATASHA P.  There is to be no contact, directly or indirectly or through third party contact.  Defense counsel is to draft order.
Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation and US Mail privileges signed and filed.

Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is requesting that the court modify conditions of bail pending sentencing and adjourn sentencing that is set for 6-11-2015.  
Arguments are made by counsels. Defense believes that there is evidence that the victim now is recanting her statements; court tells defense that there must be corroboration of alleged recantation.
The state believes that there has been improper manipulation of victim from the jail by the defendant. The state does not doubt the integrity of the victim and if it did would be asking the court to vacate the jury verdicts.
Defense counsel is requesting to speak with the victim/witness advocate who worked with the victim on this case; the state objects and informs counsel that by statute that is prohibited.
At the request of the state the court is ordering that the telephone, mail and visitation privileges of the defendant be rescinded until further order of the court. State to draft order for court's signature.
The court will set matter for hearing on June 5 at 8:15; any information for the court to review is to be filed by Noon on June 4.
Motion for Modification of Conditions of Bail and Motion for Continuance filed by defense

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 652
cf

Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting to recall victim, NP, to re-open testimony.  State objects.  In chambers discussion. Back on record. The court continues its prior ruling and sustains the objection.
Jury in the box at 9:25am.  Sworn for the state: PO Janelle Jurkiewicz(Cudahy PD); Stephanie Kuntz, Sr. DNA Analyst-State Crime Lab.  Recalled PO Jurkiewicz.  Sworn for the state: Lynn K.; Det. Andrew Ayala(Cudahy PD).  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Exhibits 8-10 received.  Jury out of the box at 10:25am.
Defense motion to dismiss is denied by the court.
Colloquy between the court and defendant as to his decision to testify in his own behalf.  Court finds it to be a free and voluntary decision to testify.  Jury in the box at 10:55am.  Sworn for the defense: Jesse P.  Defense rests. State rests.
Testimony closed.  Jury out of the box at 11:40am.  Court places on record jury instructions to be read to jury which are agreed to by counsels.  Jury in the box at 11:45am.  Court begins instructions and releases jury for lunch until 1:10pm
All parties present in court at 1:10pm.  Counsels are in agreement as to substantive instructions and verdicts.
Jury in the box at 1:15pm.  Court continues instructions to jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Rebuttal argument by the state.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror (#17) selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:00pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Sanfilippo and Spottek who were duly sworn for that purpose. 
Counsels and defendant agree that exhibits may be given to jury upon request, with exception of #8 (CD).
At the hour of 2:15pm the jury sent a question to the court referring to counts 6 and 7 of the Information.
Counsels and defendant stipulate to response to be sent back to jury.
At the hour of 2:20pm the jury sent a question to the court requesting the crime scene photos #8.
Photos were printed from CD and sent to jury marked as #8-A.
At the hour of 2:45pm the jury sent a question to the court requesting additional clarification of counts 6 and 7.
Counsels and defendant stipulate to response to be sent back to jury.
At the hour of 3:50pm the jury reached verdicts and at 4:00pm were in the box and returned the following verdicts by the foreperson (#12):
Count 1:  We, the jury, find the defendant NOT GUILTY of Battery
Count 2:  We, the jury, find the defendant NOT GUILTY of Second Degree Sexual Assault
Count 3:  We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Battery
Count 4:  We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of False Imprisonment
Count 5:  We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Strangulation and Suffocation
Count 6:  We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Second Degree Sexual Assault
Count 7:  We, the jury, find the defendant GULITY of Second Degree Sexual Assault
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to counts 3-7 and Judgments of Acquittal as to counts 1 and 2.
Court orders PSI and remands defendant pending sentencing on 6-11-2015 at 8:15
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess weapons or body armor and his civil rights are suspended until restored.

Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state places its offer on the record and it is rejected by the defendant.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:30am.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Court recesses for the lunch hour and directs jurors and counsels to return at 1:00pm.
Jury in the box and sworn at 1:10pm.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Natasha P; PO Brian Scott, Cudahy PD-retired.  Exhibits 1-5 received. Jury out of the box at 2:55pm; jury in the box at 3:10pm.  Sworn for the state:  Nina Deering, SANE-Aurora Sinai. Exhibit 6-7 received.
Sworn for the state:  PO Bradley Summers (Cudahy PD); PO Aaron Agenten(Cudahy PD).
Court directs jurors to return at 8:45 on 4-28-2015.  Court reminds panel not to conduct any investigations.  Jury out of the box at 4:30pm.

Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court, defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State will provide DNA report to defense counsel upon receipt.  Parties are prepared for trial on 4-27-2015.
Justice Point Report.
State's Witness List
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties prepared for trial.  Court sets another final pretrial to make sure there are no issues prior to trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Scheduling conference held.    Speedy trial demand.   Case set for final pretrial on 3-24-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 4-27-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-16-2015.
COURT IS SETTING A TOTAL OF $20,000.00 Cash bail.

Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court, defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion to modicy bail is argued.  State objects to any decrease.  The court is in agreement with the state and will INCREASE the cash bail to $20,000 with all other conditions to remain the same.
for Modification of Conditions of Bail

Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Andrew Ayala-Cudahy Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NMP

Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Jesse Steven Poehlman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 1 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
